Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Recommendations For Case 102 ensure that escalation doesnt bypass necessary steps like investigation If a ticket requires escalating for further action check if there are policies causing escalations to be logged without corresponding investigation initiation Introduce time thresholds Any delay beyond X minutes between activities eg assign and investigate should trigger alerts or interventions Investigate agent availability and workload around triage assign times If tickets consistently have long waits before investigation starts consider staffing changes or prioritization rules

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Other cases like 102 and 104 are outliers compared to the average 2h for case101 The analysis shows these two took over a day each on average 32 hours which is unreasonably high in customer support contexts This indicates systemic issues such as process inefficiencies resource constraints or misaligned workflows causing bottlenecks
